cs.astronomy.com/2014/12/looking-back-wi.snippet: It doesn't rely on punny-ness but, instead, explains what a brown dwarf is: an object that failed to become a bright-burning star. But that's a pretty simplified definition, and it only conveys what a brown dwarf isn't, not what it is.

oklo.org/2014/11/systemic-brown-dwarfs.snippet: Brown dwarfs (of which no airtight examples were known) were a way station for the impatient. There seemed something electrifying about the possibility that a dim failed star might be drifting by, just few light years away.
